metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29390 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
libjpeg-turbo version 2.0.90 has a heap-based buffer over-read (2 bytes) in decompress_smooth_data in jdcoefct.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29390` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libturbojpeg - 2.1.5-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

libjpeg-turbo-progs - 2.1.5-2ubuntu1
libjpeg-turbo8 - 2.1.5-2ubuntu1
libturbojpeg-java - 2.1.5-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> libjpeg-turbo is a fork of libjpeg8 mdeslaur> the libjpeg package is an unrelated codebase ccdm94> according to upstream, this issue was introduced with commit 6d91e95, on version 2.1 beta1[6(b)].

criterions.comment: libjpeg-turbo package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.5-2ubuntu1').
libjpeg-turbo package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.5-2ubuntu1').
